intro: Helipterum splendidum, commonly known as the showy helipterum, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its showy, clustered inflorescences. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers are usually pink or red, with five petals and prominent stamens. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
